modName: 360 Walk and Run Plus - Speed Options
summary: Four options for 360 Walk and Run Plus users to set speeds for default character movement. One also corrects the backward walk speed unlike the 360 Walk and Run Plus optional ESP. The other three options can be used if you also use the Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed mod or just like the speeds available in that mod.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#bf9000][size=5]Description[/size][/color]
[size=3]The '360 Walk and Run Plus' mod lets players walk and run facing the game camera, but only when hands are unequipped and not sneaking or sprinting, etc.  This movement type is called default movement style in the game files.

The '360 Walk and Run Plus' mod also includes an optional plug-in called:
 '360WalkandRunPlus-RunBackwardSpeedAdjust.esp'.
If you do not use the plug-in, the backward run speed will be noticeably slower than the forward run speed.
The plug-in adjusts the backward run speed so that it is the same as the forward run speed in unmodded Skyrim.
However, the plug-in does not adjust the backward walking speed, and it will be a little slower than the forward walking speed.

Players that use '360 Walk and Run Plus' and who also use a mod called 'Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed' are faced with a dilemma.  Without the 360's optional backward speed adjust plug-in their backward walk and run speeds will not be the same as their forward speeds.  With the 360's optional backward speed adjust plug-in their forward walk and run speeds will no longer be the same as the realistic mod's provided speeds.

This mod provides fixes for the above problems.  It provides four options for '360 Walk and Run Plus' users to set speeds for default character movement with a replacement for the '360 Walk and Run Plus' mod's optional plug-in.
[/size]

[b]1) Vanilla[/b]
Unlike the optional ESP included with '360 Walk and Run Plus', which only corrects the backward run speed, this also corrects the backward walk speed.
Additionally, it sets the left and right walk speeds to be the same as the forward walk speed. See table below for unmodded Skyrim values.
 Walk speed = 080.099998
 Run speed = 370.000000

[b]2) Realistic Walk and Run[/b]
Increases the walk speed and decreases the run speed to be the same as for the 'Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed' mod.
 Walk speed = 125.000000
 Run speed = 305.000000

[b]3) Realistic Walk[/b]
Increases the walk speed to be the same as for the 'Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed' mod.
 Walk speed = 125.000000
 Run speed = 370.000000

[b]4) Realistic Run[/b]
Decreases the run speed to be the same as for the 'Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed' mod.
 Walk speed = 080.099998
 Run speed = 305.000000

The latter three 'Realistic ...' options are mainly intended for use if you also use the 'Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed' mod, but it is not required.
You can use them without the other mod to gain that mod's changes in walk and/or run speed.


[color=#bf9000][size=4]Unmodded Skyrim default movement speeds
[/size][/color]080.089996 Left Walk
079.750000 Right Walk
080.099998 Forward Walk
071.930000 Backward Walk
205.250000 Backward Run
370.000000 Left/Right/Forward Run

[color=#bf9000][size=4]Installation notes[/size][/color]
1) If you are using the '360 Walk and Run Plus' mod's optional run backward speed adjust plug-in, that plug-in is no longer needed.
2) If you also use the 'Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed' mod ...
adjust plug-in load order so that the chosen speed option plug-in overrides the 'Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed' mod's plug-in.

[color=#bf9000][size=4]Will conflict with[/size][/color]
Any mod that also changes the Skyrim.esm record controlling default movement speeds.

[color=#bf9000][size=4]Requires[/size][/color]
[url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34508/]360 Walk and Run Plus[/url]

[color=#bf9000][size=4]Credits
[/size][/color][url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/32229/]Realistic Humanoid Movement Speed[/url]
author: Ravenscans
